turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I want him. I want him so much. I'll kill myself if I can't have him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: There, there, my baby.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You better bring him home, if you really love him. Don't kill love. You'll regret it for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Who said anything about love?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What is it, pet?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: He's being posted. I was terrible to him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't leave it like that. Go after him. Swallow your pride.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: He said I was right. I shouldn't wait for him. I was better to make a clean break.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I think it's very sensible in the circumstances.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Now he's gone and made me fall in love with him, which I never wanted to do. I told him that.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't believe this is happening to me.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: It's not. It's happening to me.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: It looks a bit fishy to me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Could we salt them, or smoke them, do you think?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Now take deep breaths, and push.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Why? It's coming on its own. It doesn't hurt.

turns.speaker: GRANDMA
turns.text: Is it peace in out time?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No, Mother! It's War! War!

turns.speaker: GRANDMA
turns.text: Or what?

turns.speaker: GRANDMA
turns.text: Did they say how long it would take to get new ration books, Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Up to six weeks, I think.

turns.speaker: GRANDMA
turns.text: How are we going to cope?

turns.speaker: GRANDMA
turns.text: ...such nice boys with straw boaters and blazers. All the punts lit up with Chinese lanterns. Like fireflies. And the gramophone going on one of the boats. Always the Charleston, the Charleston, the Charleston. Oh, you girls.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Wasn't it lovely?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It was the best time of his life.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: How many of our class left? You and me out of twenty-eight.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I can't do it. What's the point?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's just the wrench, Grace. It's for their sake.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Please yourself.  Let them go, if they want.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Grace!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It seems to have survived.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Play something, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Mac, that was wonderful. I haven't been to a concert since...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: ...since I used to take you to the Proms?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: That's right. Not since then Not since I got married.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Remember this beach, Mac? All those summers. Out two families, together.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Happy days.  When you're bigger, Bill, I'll teach you the googly.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Mac, did you ever find out who Molly went off with?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: A Polish pilot. It's like one of those jokes on the wireless.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: She said, 'I know you love me, Mac, but you've never loved me enough.'

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Not loving enough. That is a terrible thing to do to someone. I suppose I did it to Clive. Always held something back.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's all better left unsaid, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You were never apart, you and Clive. He kept asking and asking.  And I waited and waited for you to say something. And you never did.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Clive had a job. I didn't. I couldn't.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He could always make me laugh.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We did the decent thing.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: This war's put an end to decent things. I want to close my eyes and jump and give myself for once, hold nothing back.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We can't change what's past. Not even the war can do that.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: We did all the proper things, and we lost love. That's sad, Mac.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Bless you, Mac. What would I have done without you?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You might still have a house.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I wish it could all have been different.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Look after yourself, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER GEORGE
turns.text: To Mary McDonald, Thelma Richardson, Bobo Hinds, Lily Sanderson...  ...Little Sarah Whats-it, now there was a spirit. And Marjorie Anderson.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Father, that's enough now

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER GEORGE
turns.text: And...and...Henry Chapman's girl, was it Thelma? No, I can see those cornflower eyes...I've lost your name, my sweetness.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What did I do to deserve this?

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER GEORGE
turns.text: You married that fool, Clive, that's what. Never mind, you can stay with us.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER GEORGE
turns.text: What can you do with four daughters, I asked myself, A string quartet was all I could come up with. They hated me for making them learn.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: And now we're glad you did.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: It's not fair on them. It's selfish to keep them with you.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: My aunt in Australia has offered..

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's so far way. I couldn't bear it.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Kids don't care. You're thinking of yourself.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I didn't mean it like that, Grace. Why does it always come out wrong?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I know you mean well.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: God, how I hate all this scrimping and squalor.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't mind it. It was harder before the war. Trying to keep up appearances. Now it's patriotic to be poor.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I don't know how you cope, Grace. Three kids, army pay. On your own.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You know something, Molly? I like it on my own. I never got used to sharing a bed, not really.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Molly!

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Well! I'm not talking about Mac. He hasn't toughed me for ages. And not often ever. My life started when Mac went on nights.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You're having me on, Molly.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Am I? Maybe I am.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You've been drinking. Your tipsy.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Tipsy, topsy, turvy.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm so glad you could come. Here we are, all together again.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Happy as can be. In the old groove.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Whoa, thanks for stopping. I been standing out there in that toad strangling rain for like a hundred million years.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Really, that's a long time.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, most people just whiz on by like I was invisible or something... or else they're creeps who wanna jam their slimy hands down my pants and twiddle my naughty-naughty.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yikes.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, icky. This one guy stops and I look in and he's got his thing out waving it around like a drunk monkey.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, I know where that is, it's right by my house. It's Dr. Satan's tree. I can show ya.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Really, wow, so it's really a real thing.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, it's a tree. I used to play there all the time. But, you can't find it without me. Outsider can't find no deadwood.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Deadwood, is that what it's called? Cool, will you show us?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Maybe, maybe, maybe... hey, you know what word I hate?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Cone.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Huh... what cone?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Any cone, yeah...  I hate that word... sounds ugly, I don't like crumple either.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I always hate saying the word cheese, every time you get your picture taken... smile, say cheese.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I know I hate Swiss cheese, the holes make me nervous.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Oh, I know. I'll show you where it's at, sweetie. Aren't you just so cute all bundled up like a cinnamon roll of Christmas love.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The lions were totally covered in this guy's blood... I think they ate his face off, tore open his rib cage, pulled his legs off... it was a wild scene.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Things like that get a lot bloodier than ya think.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I agree.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, it won't take long and besides you sassy poodle girls will slow us down.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Please don't kill us, please don't kill us.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Please don't kill us, please don't kill us.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Tiny's home.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: What about R.J.?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Oh, he was already gone before I seen him... but Tiny saw him and said he said he was going out to the yard to get a new wheel.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Ma, Tiny's in.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Go tell him to get your Grandpa.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I'll cut your fucking tits off and shove 'em down your throat.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Baby! Stop!

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Come on, ma... this bitch's got it coming.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No, I told you...

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Drink up, it's party time.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Enjoy your last night...  ...where's Otis?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Oh, he's coming, he got something real special this year.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Who's your Daddy!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Who's your Daddy!

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Take his gag out, it's more fun with the screaming.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Yeah, I like the screaming too... it's so much more exciting.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Aw, I was going home to my Mamma's house... yeah, I was out doing this thing.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Where's that?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Couple more miles up this road.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What about the tree?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Oh yeah, the tree.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Which way?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Go straight up about another mile... til we hit Cherrypicker Road and turn right... it ain't far from there.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I guess I'll try to back it out on the rim... at least to the main road.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: If you keep going straight you can get back on the interstate... it's easier.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: OK, whatever. Let's go get your brother's truck. Faster we get the truck, faster we get out of here.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: How much further?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Almost there... are you in a hurry or something?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Well, yeah, kind of.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: The door's locked. I'll gotta go around... wait here.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Christ, you scared the shit out of me.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Aw, you ain't seen nothing yet.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Is your brother ready to go?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Oh... yeah, he already left. We'll wait inside, come on.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: He left!

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, come on.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: So, you live here alone... I mean with just your brother?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: No. There's a bunch a us 'round somewhere... I think Mamma's sleepin'. She sleeps a lot, now... do you want marshmallows?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Um, yeah sure, I guess.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: You sure do a lot of guessing.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hey, um...  ...what kind of animal is that?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: A dead one.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Mmmmm, this is tasty.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Ain't the only thing tasty in this house.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I wonder what time it is. Seems kind of late.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Don't worry, sugar. It ain't past my bedtime... are you flirting with me?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What? No, I'm was worried that... I was just wondering what's taking so long.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Oh. Maybe R.J. got into a crash and killed everbody?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: That's not something to joke about.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: OK, sorry... maybe the Great Pumpkin ate 'em up.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hey, great they're back.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Whoopie fucking doo.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: No! He's one of God's creatures, he can't help it if he's dumb... I'm just crazy about animals.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: The animals have got nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I'd like to see that.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Nice.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Can I help you with something?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I was just wondering.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Wondering what?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Are you two gals all funny with each other?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: You know... a couple of queers.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Do you believe this fucking girl?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I was just wondering, cause you got a pissy look about you... like a real pussy licking bitch.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What the hell are you laughing about?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I just pictured the tire sitting in a chair watching TV.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, wonderful.  Fucking psycho.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: He walks, duh.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Fucking great.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Take that, you fucking slut!  Fucking redneck whore!

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: You shouldn't a done that.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Why? You gonna do something about it?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, I'll do something.

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: You all having a Halloween party tonight?

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Now, what makes you think that?

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: You all sure are buying a lot of holy water for two people.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Yeah, well we like to get fucked up and do fucked up shit, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: Yeah, yeah...  ...I like to fuck shit up.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: I'll bet you do... how much we owe ya...  ...Goober?

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: Actually it's G. Ober... Gerry Ober, but the guys drew in the other O, fucking assholes.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Great story Goober, how much?

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: Ummmm... two hundred and eighty-five dollars.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Keep the change and get yourself a new name.

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: Holy crap, thanks!

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: Come on, bro. Let's go.

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: Hey, wait take this.

turns.speaker: BABY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: CASHIER
turns.text: A missing girl. I use'ta go to school with her, she just up and disappeared some day... real weird.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: How long have you been running this place?

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: How long is a piece of string? Too God damn long, that's how long.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: No, really.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Shit, I don't remember exactly. I took over for my Pa just after the Duke nabbed the Oscar.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: The Duke?

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Yeah, my Pa wasn't right in the head after that.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You mean John Wayne?

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Hell, boy there some other Duke you know about?  A great American.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah, I was never that big of a western fan. I like science fiction.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: I figured that much. Why the fuck you asking so many jackass questions for?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You see me and my friends are writing a book on offbeat roadside attractions. You know all the crazy shit you see when you drive cross country.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: I don't drive cross country.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: But if you did.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: But suppose for a second you did.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Y'all find us country people real funny like don't ya... well, God damn pack up the mule and sling me some grits, I'ze a gotta get me some schooling.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: No, no I think it's really interesting.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Well fuck me Side Sally, who want to read about all that horse shit anyway.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Really? Huh, I thought for sure you'd say Lynette Fromme. She's got that snooty vibe I know you dig.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Sqeaky! No way, she ain't that hot.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: She's pretty cute.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah but, she reminds me of this chick that I remember from fourth grade... called a... shit, what did we call her?  Oh yeah, Patty Pee-pee Pants... when ever she got called on by Miss Chumski, this chick would piss in her pants and start bawling.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: There always one kid with no bodily controls. We had this dude, Jeff Baxter, he was a puker. The fucker would just sit there puke all over himself.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Better than pissing... anyway so, what's your choice?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: If we're talking cute... like regular cute, I'd say Leslie Van Houton, but cute ain't hot.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah, no shit.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: As far a hot... goes I gotta go with... Ruth Ann Moorehouse.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Oh yeah, I forgot about her. She was pretty hot.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Fuck yeah, she is. I'd join a cult to get some of that... and the best part is she didn't try to kill the President or nothing, so that baggage ain't hanging around.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I thought she tried to murder a witness for the prosecution.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll let it slide, she was only seventeen.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Dude, talk about baggage, that ain't no carry-on shit, that's some heavy duty Samsonite shit.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess... hot chicks are always nuts.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hot has got nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hold on, I've heard this before... but I can't remember the end.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So, the guy goes to Hell and the devil says, "do you smoke?" The guy say, "yeah"... the devil say, "great cause Tuesday is cigar night, sweetest Cuban cigars you ever had."

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Shit, we really need to find some gas.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Then the devil asks, "do you drink?" Guy says, "yeah"... devil say, "wonderful, Wednesday is free drinks night, best booze you ever had... all made from the finest stuff."

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Then the devil says, "are you gay?" Guy says, "fuck no"... Devil says, "Well then, I guess you're gonna hate Thursdays."

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Oh yeah, I remember now.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah, no shit I just told ya.  Hey, you think this place called Alien Ed's UFO Welcoming Center is still around? It says, "Where the Fact is separated from the Fantasy."

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I dunno... we'll ask around as we get closer. Man, I really don't want to run out of gas out here in the middle of Petticoat Junction, man.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Don't panic yourself, way too much caffeine guy... I see a sign.  Captain Spaulding's Museum of Madmen and Monsters... cool. Also... fried chicken and... gasoline... next exit.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Perfect.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I hope this place is cool. We could use something interesting to liven up chapter 12.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I'll pump the gas. Go inside and see if it's worth thinking about.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: OK, Boss.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Holy crap. You gotta see this place. It's awesome.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: How awesome?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Really fucking awesome.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Wake up the chicks and bust out the camera awesome?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hell yeah.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Keep straight on this road here.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: How much further?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not exactly sure... it looks close. Did we pass an abandoned school bus yet?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Come on, we need something like this. It could be the real deal. It's too far out of the way to come back to.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's a hitchhiker.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Way out here?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: She looks like she stinks.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Cat fight, cat fight.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That reminds me of a film I saw once of a guy who got out of his car at Lion Country Safari to take a picture of a lion cub and got eaten by the lions.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Oh yeah, I heard about that. I always thought it was bullshit.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No... yeah, they ripped him to pieces while his family watched from the car. The wife is screaming, the kids are crying. Some dude in another car filmed the whole thing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Fuck. I think we blew a tire.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: OK, let's relax. I'll check it, maybe I'm wrong. Don't everybody freak out just yet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll help ya.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Gee, ya think it wouldn't be too much trouble.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I hope you fixed the spare like I asked ya.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah, I fixed it. Well, I ain't... um, I can't remember. I think I took it out to fit the bags and forgot to put it back.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, technically I did what ya said.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You're a real fucking piece of work.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Tire's fucking gone crap on us, man. There's no saving it now.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: And the spare is safely sitting in Jerry's garage.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Don't forget the flashlight, it's pretty dark out there.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, don't worry she didn't get offended by what I said. You two got to lighten up... right, Bill?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Whatever, at this point all I care about is food. I'm starving and I got a fucking killer headache.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, I asked you if you wanted some chicken.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Didn't look like chicken to me, more like fried pussy cat.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Tasted pretty good.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know, this is fucking nuts.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Almost there.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Jesus, you think she was really gonna cut you?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I like sleep.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Here he comes.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Honk at him. Scare him.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: He won't move.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Fuck! We are fucked!

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Turn that fucking radio off!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah, maybe R.J. could just tow us and our car to the nearest garage.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I mean obviously we will compensate you for your troubles.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: What's he so excited about?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, showtime for what?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Just grin and bear it.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: That food...  ugh, I feel like I'm gonna puke.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Shit, I'm all for being a sport, but this is ridiculous.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Man, it's already ten thirty.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yeah, I'd say at this point all we can do is just wait it out. There's nothing else.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I suppose. I mean they're obviously all bonkers, but I guess they're harmless.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Don't look back, just get in the car.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Lock the fucking doors.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: We'll need pictures of the inside too.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Alright, alright. I know... I wanted to be the photographer.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Well, don't even think about playing the good samaritan, there's way too many psychos wandering loose these days.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: It's a girl.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Should we stop?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: We can't leave her out here in the rain... maybe we can just drop her at the next rest area.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: She looks like a freak.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Sounds like a magical trip through the heartland.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Where ya headed?
